ovdesc.p: To Store the Unprocessed Schedules of a Swap contract

desc.p: Holds the Leg Type of a particular Schedule type.
Holds the amount (or Rate) of a particular Schedule type.
Process value for different type of Schedules is as follows
RR RR Rate(If NULL, holds the CURRENT.RATE)
Indicates the type of Activity to be triggered for a specific Schedule type in order to generate messages.
Presence of value in this field indicates that the details in this Multi-value are related to Message generation only.
The actual message that is generated for this activity code is specified in the SWAP.ADVICES file.
Indicates the date on which the message will be generated.
This field will be present only if ACTIVITY.CODE field is present.
A unique key by which unprocessed schedule of SWAP is identified.
It is generated by the system for a SWAP contract and for a date, which corresponds to the Schedule date of a SWAP contract for particular Schedule type.
The Schedule date will undergo a change in case the Day.Convention is 'Following' or 'Modified' and where the Process.Date is greater than the Orig.Sched.Date.
The ID format is <SWAP contract ID>. <Schedule Date>
Contains 21 characters with a decimal point after 12 characters.
First 12 characters specifies ID of SWAP contract
Holds the Period end date for an IP schedule. This will be the end date of current interest period. This is calculated based on the AS/LB.DATE.ADJUSTMENT.
NULL/VALUE the effective date is the same as the schedule date.
PERIOD the effective date will be the process date determined by
This field determines the date when the schedules will be processed based on the DAY.CONVENTION and the BUSINESS.CENTRES
NULL the process date is the same as the schedule date.
"FOLLOWING" the process date will be the first following day that is a business day.
"PRECEDING" the process date will be the first preceding day that is a business day.
"MODIFIED" the process date will be the first following day that is a business
day unless the day falls in the next calendar month, in which case the process date will be
the first preceding day that is a business day.
Indicates narrative description of a particular Schedule type. Holds the contents of AS/LB.NARR field of a SWAP contract.
Holds the Value date for the schedule, which is calculated based on the AS/LB.DATE.ADJUSTMENT.
NULL the entry date is the same as the schedule date.
VALUE/PERIOD the entry date will be the process date determined by DAY.CONVENTION.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Indicates SCHEDULE.TYPE of a SWAP contract for which processing will be done.
Must be a valid definition of SWAP.SCHEDULE.TYPE file.
Presence of this field is required to handle the processing of various Swap Schedules as per the
Day.Convention and Date.Adjustment. It holds the Original date of the schedule.
System compares the Orig.Sched.Date with the Process.Date and does the following.
a) If the Process.Date is greater than Orig.Sched.Date, then system creates a new Swap.Schedule
with ID same as the Process.date, during the COB of the Orig.Sched.Date.
Thus the Swap.Schedule is retained for processing at a future date.
b)If the Process.Date is less than the Orig.Sched.Date, then system processes the respective
Swap.Schedule during the COB of the Process.Date itself.
